title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 190.40 - Adirondack Rail Trail
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 190.40 - Adirondack Rail Trail

State Regulations

In addition to other applicable general provisions of this

Part, the following requirements apply to the Adirondack Rail Trail. In the
event of a conflict between this section and another section of this Part, the
more restrictive provision will control. (a) Description. For purposes of this section
the Adirondack Rail Trail shall mean the section of State land under the
jurisdiction of the department beginning at Station Street in Lake Placid and
ending at the Tupper Lake Depot in Tupper Lake within the Remsen-Lake Placid

Travel Corridor in the Town of North Elba in Essex County, and the Towns of

Har-rietstown, Santa Clara, and Tupper Lake in Franklin County. (b) No person, by any means, shall travel on
any portion of the Adirondack Rail Trail at a speed in excess of the posted
speed limit, nor shall any person fail to comply with any traffic control sign
or device along the Adirondack Rail Trail. Notes

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
